Decrease product quality to reduce costs
Stop investing in product improvements entirely

options: Validate assumptions with potential customers through interviews or tests
Focus solely on long-term revenue projections

questions.question: Your initial financial model shows a high customer acquisition cost (CAC), making the business less viable. What action could improve the model?
options: Experiment with more cost-effective marketing channels or referral incentives

questions.question: You need initial funding but want to retain maximum ownership of your company. Which financing approach should you consider first?
options: Immediately accepting large venture capital investments

questions.question: You have 5 minutes to pitch to a potential investor. Which approach is most effective?

questions.question: Customers say they value your UVP, but their engagement is low. How can you address this gap?

options: Invest in validated improvements that advance towards product-market fit

questions.question: During pitch practice, observers struggle to understand your unique value proposition. What’s the most effective response?
options: Simplify the language, incorporate a user story, and clarify the core benefit

Provide only raw data without explanation

options: Continue with the same channel regardless of cost

questions.question: Your startup’s strategy relies heavily on a single supplier with no backup. How might you improve your risk management?

questions.question: You’ve tested your lean canvas assumptions with early adopters. How can you best leverage these insights?

questions.question: Investors want to see the path to profitability. Which approach strengthens their confidence?

Blame the market for slow growth

questions.question: Your team has developed multiple prototypes but is unsure which resonates most with users. What’s the next step?
options: Pick the one you personally prefer

questions.question: Your financial model shows a steady burn rate. How can you proactively ensure enough runway?
options: Assume future revenue will appear out of nowhere

questions.question: You discover that early adopter feedback conflicts with assumptions you made on your lean canvas. What’s the right approach?
options: Stick to your original assumptions despite evidence

questions.question: Your initial pitch deck is lengthy and complex. What improves its impact?

questions.question: While validating your solution, you find that customers appreciate your product but are not willing to pay. What should you explore?
options: Investigate why they won’t pay—test alternate pricing models, clarify the UVP, or explore different customer segments

questions.question: You’re nearing product-market fit, but your supply chain can’t scale ethically. How can you address this?
options: Scale anyway and ignore ethical issues
